intro: Mitrasacme neglecta, commonly known as the slender false holly, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
